document_data.name: ''Standing Bear''
document_data.mainbody: The '''''standing bear''''' was a magical chalice carved in the shape of a [[bear]]. It was one of the ''[[Wo-ha Ui-jung]]'', a collection of magical vessels created by the [[Han people]] of [[Koryo]] in ancient times.
document_data.Powers: Those who drank from it received the strength of a [[bear]] for three hours, but also developed a flushed appearance and an excitable mood.
document_data.History:
As one of the ''Wo-ha Ui-jung'', the ''standing bear''<nowiki>'s</nowiki> powers had most likely at one stage influenced the history of Koryo.

For many years, the ''standing bear'' was in the possession of the [[Yio Dufong]], a [[yakuza]] clan in [[T'o na'Chee]]. All the Yio Dufong would imbibe before a fight, and for this reason they were called the "bears". However, the ''standing bear'' was later stolen and by [[1357 DR]] had still not turned up.[[Category:Items from Northeast Kara-Tur]]
